Text:
Cheers for the share. :)

FLAC is the best!

@politux Loseless Audio Checker (a freeware program) reports a cutoff for these files, so I'm not sure if they're geniune FLAC. Still, they sound good to me! Maybe someone else who knows more about audio than I do can comment
If its not real flac you should have this deleted.
@politux I'm not sure one way or another. How can one tell for sure? In any case, I couldn't find Opus 131 in any other format beside this here, not even in mp3.

@politux Based on this forum post, it seems like the Loseless Audio Checker utility is capable of producing false positives (i.e. it sometimes claims that a file is lossy when it in fact is lossless): http://forums.bakabt.me/index.php?topic=24975.0 Or, perhaps, the original CD of the Alan Berg Quartet recordings contained lossy audio. Since, for all I know, these audio files are genuinely lossless, I won't delete this torrent just yet. And, like I said, I'm not aware of any free online source from which to download Beethoven's Opus 131 in any higher audio quality than this torrent
Checked the files with Audacity, spikes hit 22k meaning it is legitimate FLAC. :)
The official FLACTester also confirms that this is legit FLAC! :)

Want this music on your iPod or in iTunes? Download dBpowerAMP Music Converter and convert the files into Apple Loseless. :)
